options.content:
Domain ${__org.name}
Linux server : $server

panels.description:
Show the total availability time for the last 7 days

* Agent ping is a test from prometheus server to the agent.  
* Uptime is the system uptime on the server. 

The server can still be running, while prometheus cannot join the server agent.  
If the server is really unavailable, both statuses will be red / down

To allow a large relative time without losing precision, the time() interval must be explicitly set to 5m
panels.title: Availability history: $server

panels.description:
* user: usage for application processes (normal)  
* nice: same as user with a lower priority  
* system + *irq: usage for the kernel (abnormal, hardware or driver related)  
* iowait : waiting time (abnormal, drive or network latency)  
* steal: virtualized cpu waiting for real cpu (abnormal, too many VM)  

More information can be found here : https://www.kernel.org/doc/html/latest/admin-guide/cpu-load.html
panels.title: CPU $cpu usage

panels.description:
* User: processes usage
* Buffered : block device mapping cache 
* Slab : cache for memory object addresses
* Cached : general cache (reused if required)

More information can be found here : 
https://www.kernel.org/doc/html/latest/filesystems/proc.html#meminfo
panels.title: Memory usage (stack graph)

panels.description:
vmstat swap statistics.
The values stands for : from disk (in) and to disk (out).   
For the purpose of the graph, the metrics are inverted to obtain in/out of swap.  

You can find more information here : https://www.linuxjournal.com/article/8178
panels.title: Swap usage

panels.description: Inodes are metadata structure keeping track of files and directories on the filesystem
panels.title: Filesystem inode usage

panels.description:
In-memory inode handlers  
For more information: https://www.kernel.org/doc/html/latest/admin-guide/sysctl/fs.html
panels.title: sysctl stats - memory inodes (stack graph)

panels.description:
Filesystem dynamic entries  
For more information: https://www.kernel.org/doc/html/latest/admin-guide/sysctl/fs.html
panels.title: sysctl stats - Dynamic pages

panels.description:
Logical file handles  
For more information: https://www.kernel.org/doc/html/latest/admin-guide/sysctl/fs.html
panels.title: sysctl stats - open file handles (VFS)

panels.description:
System-wide number of asynchronous io requests  
For more information: https://www.kernel.org/doc/html/latest/admin-guide/sysctl/fs.html
panels.title: sysctl stats - aio events

panels.description:
Prometheus system agent  
Any error can also occur because the module is not applicable
panels.title: Prometheus node exporter - scrape status error

list.description: Datasource to use for this dashboard
list.name: dsdashboard

list.description: Note : major:minor could also be use, cf : https://lxr.linux.no/#linux+v2.6.31/Documentation/devices.txt
list.label: Drive
list.name: drive
